intro: Tapinanthus engleri, commonly known as the Engleri dodder, is a parasitic flowering plant that lacks chlorophyll and relies entirely on its host for nutrients. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is native to parts of Africa, particularly in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers and has a vine-like structure that缠绕 its host. It is known for its ability to infest a variety of host plants, including shrubs and trees. Due to its parasitic nature, it can cause significant damage to its host's growth and vitality.
